IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: CASE NUMBER: 23-MSP-039254 INVESTIGATING TROOPER: Trooper First Class M. Mowbray #7119 NATURE OF CALL: Shooting Investigation SCENE PROCESSING: Scene processing was conducted; the following items have been attached to this report; Forty (40) digital photographs taken at the scene uploaded to RMS and VeriPic One (1) MSP form 76 Written Statement margin-left:8px">One (1) MSP form 41 Crime Scene Entry Log INCIDENT FOOTAGE: LABELED 23-MSP-039254 ON AXON EVIDENCE INCIDENT CAPTURED BY BODY WORN CAMERA (BWC): TFC M. Mowbray #7119 Body-Worn Camera Footage: partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1" target="_blank">https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=d4d442af55b24b4b97c67771819d5323partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 NARRATIVE: On November 7, 2023, at 2236 hours I, Trooper First Class M. Mowbray #7119 of the Maryland State Police, was dispatched to 1021 Wagner Point Road, Cambridge, Dorchester County, Maryland 21613 for a report of a shooting. Upon my arrival I made contact with the complainant; identified as Michael Arlandis Robinson (DOB: 10/06/1950) [hereinafter identified as Robinson]. Robinson advised that at around 2230 hours, while washing dishes within his kitchen, he heard a single gunshot followed by four to five additional shots striking the front of his house. Robinson stated that he looked outside but did not see anything. Robinson stated that he then called 911 to report the incident. Robinson noted that his wife; identified as Beverly Ann Robinson (DOB: 01/10/1956), was asleep in an upstairs bedroom at the time of the incident. Robinson provided the following written statement on a Maryland State Police form 76; I was washing dishes in the kitchen when I heard 5 or 6 pops hitting the house, my wife was asleep upstairs. I looked but I did not see anything. When asked if he had any issues with his neighbors or knew of anyone who would want to harm him Robinson did not know of any outstanding issues or anything noteworthy. I then inquired with Robinson who else resided at the residence to which he identified his grandson; identified as Montae LeEdward Kellam (DOB: 07/23/2005) [hereinafter identified as Kellam], as an additional resident, however, was not home at the time of the shooting. Robinson estimated that Kellam left the residence between 1900 hours and 2030 hours to go in town. I asked Robinson if he knew of anyone that Kellam had been having issues with to which he advised that Kellam had been jumped by a group of individuals in the week prior at the Walmart in Easton, Maryland. Robinson stated that the incident was handled by local law enforcement. Upon further investigation it was revealed that Kellam was assaulted by known assailants while at work on October 29, 2023, in a case that was handled by the Easton Police Department. I asked Robinson to contact Kellam in an effort to have him return home which was unsuccessful after numerous attempts. While on scene I surveyed the damage to the interior and exterior of the residence. Starting on the southwest corner of the residence, a large hole in the upper glass pane in the lower first floor window appearing to be caused by a bullet. Upon following the general trajectory, it appears a bullet entered the glass from the southwest and proceeded through a drape and into a wall within the living room, 10-15 feet away from where Robinson was standing within the kitchen. A bullet fragment was observed in the living room wall. Moving to the right of that window, damage was observed consistent with that of another bullet striking the siding. Moving towards the window to the right of the aforementioned one was another bullet hole within the with window frame. Following the trajectory of that projectile, a bullet was observed lodged into the screen siding still in place within the window. On the same window paint damage and another bullet hole were observed on the right side. To the left of the door frame, a bullet hole could be seen to the left of the sidelight which went through the wood, into the door frame, into the storm door. Another bullet hole could be observed on the left sidelight which traveled through the wood, struck the storm door and went into the right side of the door and became lodged within the wood. A separate bullet hole could be observed to the glass front door which led into the storm door where it appears it went in and cause slight bowing to the storm doors interior side. To the right of the doorway and slightly above the two first floor windows, another bullet hole could be observed to the residence. While on scene I took forty (40) digital photographs of the scene which were uploaded to VeriPic. Robinson was provided with the Maryland State Police case number as well as a Maryland Crime Victim and Witnesses pamphlet. The following addresses were checked for footage with negative results; 1020 Wagner Point Road, Cambridge, Maryland 1029 Wagner Point Road, Cambridge, Maryland 5848 Ross Neck Road, Cambridge, Maryland 1007 Wagner Point Road, Cambridge, Maryland was checked for footage and contact was made with the homeowner; the Honorable Melvin Jews. Judge Jews reviewed the footage which revealed no pertinent or beneficial evidence. Judge Jews noted that while returning home from Cambridge he was behind a dark in color sedan which pulled into the driveway at 1021 Wagner Point Road around 2030 hours. Due to the totality of the circumstances the response of the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division and a Crime Scene Technician were requested. Senior Trooper J. Hoffmeister #6163 responded to the scene and resumed the investigation.All additional scene processing was completed by a Crime Scene Technician. I respectfully request the case be forwarded to the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division. All events occurred in Dorchester County, Maryland.

Attachments/Evidence: My Maryland State Police issued body camera footage was uploaded to the Axon website labeled 23-MSP-039254 Shooting Investigation Narrative: On Monday, November 6, 2023, at approximately 2236 hours, Troopers from the Maryland State Police Easton Barrack were dispatched to 1021 Wagner Point Road, Cambridge, Dorchester County, Maryland 21613 for a report of a shooting. Upon arrival, Troopers contacted the victim/homeowner, identified as Michael Arlandis Robinson (DOB: 10/06/1950 [hereinafter identified as Robinson]). Robinson advised that at around 2230 hours, while cleaning the kitchen, he heard a single gunshot followed by four to five additional shots striking the front of his residence. Robinson stated that he looked outside but did not see anything. Robinson stated that he then called 911 to report the incident. Robinson advised his wife; identified as Beverly Ann Robinson (DOB: 01/10/1956 [hereinafter identified as Beverly]), was upstairs in her bedroom at the time of the incident. Robinson and Beverly were the only occupants residing in the residence at the time of the incident. The firearm projectiles did not strike anyone nor was anyone injured. Due to the nature of the incident, investigators from the Maryland State Police - Criminal Enforcement Division Eastern Region (CEDER) were contacted to respond and assume the investigation. Upon arrival, I, S/Tpr. Jeffrey Hoffmeister #6163 with CEDER surveyed the damage to the interior and exterior of the residence. A large hole, which appeared to be caused by a firearm projectile, was observed in the upper glass portion of the lower first floor window. When I entered the residence, it appeared the trajectory of the aforementioned firearm projectile traveled through the window drape and into a wall in the living room. A firearm projectile jacket was recovered from the living room wall. A projectile was recovered from the front siding in-between the two living room windows. A projectile was observed lodged into the mesh screen portion of the second lower level first floor window. A third projectile was observed lodged within the wood on the right side of the front door frame. The front door as well as the glass panel storm door was damaged from the projectiles. To the right of the front door and slightly above the two lower first floor windows, another firearm projectile hole could be observed into the siding. I spoke to Robinson and Beverly and obtained similar accounts of the incident that they provided to the troopers on scene. Robinson stated he was in the kitchen when the shooting occurred, he tried to look out the window to see if he could see anything or anyone ; however, did not see anything of evidentarty value. Beverly stated she was upstairs in the bedroom when she heard a boom twice at the door. Robinson came upstairs and told Beverly someone shot at the residence. Robinson and Beverly added, their grandson; identified as Montae LeEdward Kellam (DOB: 07/23/2005 [hereinafter identified as Kellam]) also resides at the residence; however, was not present during the incident. Beverly and Robinson both advised, Kellam was involved in an altercation where he was jumped by a group of individuals the week prior at the Walmart in Easton, Maryland. That investigation was handled by Easton Police Department. I attempted to cal Kellam and left a voice message for him to return my phone call. Kellam later called me back and advised he would be returning to the residence when his brother gets off work later in the morning. I advised Kellam I would talk to him when he returned to the residence or at a later date. Kellam did not return to the residence prior to me leaving the scene. Crime Scene Technicians assigned to the Maryland State Police Crime Scene Unit responded and conducted scene processing; written consent was obtained to conduct processing. As result, three (3) firearm projectiles and one (1) firearm projectile jacket were collected and seized from the scene. Investigators conducted numerous neighborhood checks; however, no pertinent information or video footage was obtained. Investigators will be conducted additional neighborhood/business checks for possible video surveillance and will speak with Kellam within the coming days. Case open, investigation continuing.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeTitle: Neighborhood Checks for video surveillance/ Geofence Warrant
IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Evidence/Attachments: Signed search warrant added to attachment section of this report. Neighborhood checks can be found on the Axon website under this case number. Narrative: On November 14, 2023, I, S/Tpr. Jeffrey Hoffmeister #6163 of the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division Eastern Region conducted several neighborhood checks in the area of the shooting. I responded to 1029 Wagner Point Rd, Cambridge MD and spoke with Lisa Jones [hereinafter referred to as Jones] who resides there. Jones has cameras on her property that only activate when objects are moving in close proximity to her residence. After reviewing the saved video events from the night of this incident the only video captured was when police responded to her residence after the shooting. I responded to 1006 Wagner Point Rd, Cambridge MDa spoke with Paul Arey. No pertinent information regarding the investigation was obtained. Iresponded to 1015 Wagner Point Rd, Cambridge MD and spoke with Rosalie Madairy who advised she heard about 6-7 shots the night of the investigation; however no one within the residence had any other pertinent information regarding this investigation. I responded to 5831 Ross Neck Rd, Cambridge MD and spoke with Melissa Turner [hereinafter referred to as Turner] who advised she and her husband woke up to what they thought were gun shots the night of the incident. Turner stated her husband [who I later spoke to via telephone] went outside to see if he could see anything, but nothing of evidentiary value was obtained. Turner did advise a few years back a house was broken into down Wagner Point Rd where kids believed to be from the victims in this investigations residence were the alleged suspects. On December 1, 2023, I, applied for a Geo-fence search and seizure warrant in relation to this investigation. The search and seizure warrant was signed [1510 hours/03:10 p.m.] by the Honorable William Jones, judge of the Circuit Court for Dorchester County, Maryland. The Geo-fence search and seizure warrant is in reference to the following residence located at 1021 Wagner Point Road Cambridge, MD. On December 4, 2023, I submitted the search warrant electronically by utilizing the Google Law Enforcement Request System [LERS]. Case open, investigation continuing.

Narrative: On December 8, 2023, I, S/Tpr. Jeffrey Hoffmeister #6163 of the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division Eastern Region, received Geo-fence search and seizure warrant results in relation to this investigation. Based on the results,no records were found. No google devices were located within the searched area. Case open, investigation continuing.

Narrative: I, S/Tpr. Jeffrey Hoffmeister #6163 with the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division spoke with the victim Michael Arlandis Robinson [hereinafter referred to as Robinson] several times in attempt to contact Montae LeEdward Kellam [hereinafter referred to as Kellam]. Kellam has not returned any phone calls and has not reached out to me to speak about the investigation. According to Robinson, Kellam did not provide him with any pertinent information about potential suspects or investigative leads in relation to the investigation.Due to no witnesses and no suspects identified in this investigation, all investigative leads have been exhausted, and this case will be suspended. Robinson has been made aware of the case status. I request this case to be suspended.
